Class BuildGameController

java.lang.Object
BuildGameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
class BuildGameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
BuildGameController sits between BuildGameModel and BuildGameView. It accesses and manipulates information from BuildGameModel and uses that to update BuildGameView.
Author:
Larry Chiem, Ian Rowe, Raymond Shum, Nicholas Stankovich

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private class  BuildGameController.UpdateTimerLabel
    Thread class used to requests updates to TimerGUI of myModel

  • Constructor Details

    • BuildGameController

      BuildGameController​(BuildGameModel model, BuildGameView view)
      Constructor. Begins game once model and view are created.
      Parameters:
      model - BuildGameModel class to store/retrieve data from
      view - BuildGameView class to push visual update info to

  • Method Details

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      ActionListener. Translates button clicks on GUI into actions performed on BuildGameModel. Updates BuildGameView after actions are performed.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

    • initializeGame

      private void initializeGame()
      Helper function for constructor. Begins game.

    • initializeView

      private void initializeView()
      Refreshes all elements of the myView GUI.

    • playerSelectsCard

      private void playerSelectsCard​(int actionSource)
      Stores integer value as player's currently selected card from hand.
      Parameters:
      actionSource - int representing index of card on player hand

    • computerTurn

      private void computerTurn()
      Logic for computer's movements. Computer will play a card and skip its turn if it cannot.

    • playerSelectsStack

      private void playerSelectsStack​(int actionSource)
      Checks to see if selected card from player hand can be played to selected card on the play area. Plays the card if it is possible.
      Parameters:
      actionSource -

    • computerPlaysCard

      private boolean computerPlaysCard()
      Computer attempts to play a card to the stack.
      Returns:
      boolean TRUE if computer is able to play a card, FALSE if not

    • cardCanBePlayed

      private boolean cardCanBePlayed​(int source, int destination)
      Helper function. Checks to see if source value is within 1 of destination value. Intended for integer representation of card values to be passed as arguments.
      Parameters:
      source - int value of card selected from computer or player hand
      destination - int value of target card on stack
      Returns:
      TRUE if source card can be played, FALSE if not

    • skipTurn

      private void skipTurn()
      Used to pass turn from player to computer and vice versa. Checks if neither party can move and deals new cards over the stacks if so.

    • isStackPlayable

      private boolean isStackPlayable()
      Checks to see if either player can play any card in hand to any stack. It requests view to notify player if neither party can move.
      Returns:
      TRUE if either player can move and FALSE if neither can

    • findPlayerMoveHint

      private java.lang.String findPlayerMoveHint()
      Provides one of two notifications to player. First, the first valid move that can be made. Second, if no moves can be made.
      Returns:
      String containing first or second message

    • checkGameOver

      private boolean checkGameOver()
      Checks to see if any cards are left in the deck, ends game if none are.
      Returns:
      TRUE if no cards are left (unreachable), FALSE if cards are left

    • getGameOverMessage

      public java.lang.String getGameOverMessage()
      Generates and returns string containing win, loss or tie message.
      Returns:
      String containing post game results
